title: SKPM Technical Services Management Software — Full-Featured Field Service App

requirements.text: Create a main Dashboard page displaying key performance indicators and overview stats: total open jobs, completed jobs today, pending invoices, total revenue this month, technician utilization rate, and recent activity feed. Use card-based KPI widgets and a summary chart showing job status distribution.

quotes: I Want software with all of this features

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard renders KPI cards with numeric values from backend data
Job status distribution chart is visible
Recent activity feed shows latest 10 events
All stats update from live backend state

requirements.text: Implement a Job / Work Order management module. Users can create new jobs with fields: job title, description, customer, assigned technician, priority (Low/Medium/High/Urgent), status (New/In Progress/On Hold/Completed/Cancelled), scheduled date, location/address, and notes. Support listing all jobs with filters by status, priority, technician, and date range. Allow editing and deleting jobs.

quotes: Job/work order management (create, assign, track jobs)

acceptanceCriteria: Job creation form saves a new job record to the backend
Job list displays all jobs with status badges and priority indicators
Filters by status, priority, technician, and date range work correctly
Individual job detail view shows all fields
Jobs can be edited and deleted

requirements.text: Build a CRM (Customer/Client Management) module. Each customer record includes: name, company, email, phone, address, customer type (Residential/Commercial), notes, and job history. Support creating, editing, deleting, and searching customers. Show a customer detail page with linked jobs and invoices.
acceptanceCriteria: Customer list page shows all customers in a searchable table
Customer form allows creating and editing customer records
Customer detail page lists all linked jobs and invoices
Customer records can be deleted

requirements.text: Create an Invoicing and Billing module. Invoices link to a customer and optionally to a job. Invoice fields: invoice number (auto-generated), customer, linked job (optional), issue date, due date, line items (description, quantity, unit price), subtotal, tax rate, total, payment status (Unpaid/Partial/Paid/Overdue), and notes. Support creating, editing, marking as paid, and listing invoices with filters by status and customer.
acceptanceCriteria: Invoice creation form computes subtotal, tax, and total automatically
Invoice list shows status badges and totals
Invoice number is auto-incremented on creation
Invoice status can be updated (mark as paid/overdue)
Invoices can be filtered by status and customer

requirements.text: Implement a Scheduling and Calendar module. Display a calendar view (monthly and weekly) showing scheduled jobs and technician assignments. Allow dragging or selecting a date to schedule a job. Show technician availability and assigned jobs per day. Support viewing all scheduled jobs in a list view as well.
acceptanceCriteria: Monthly and weekly calendar views render scheduled jobs as events
Clicking a date opens job scheduling form pre-filled with that date
Each event shows job title, technician name, and status
List view of upcoming scheduled jobs is available

requirements.text: Build an Inventory / Parts & Stock Management module. Each inventory item has: item name, SKU/part number, category, quantity in stock, minimum stock threshold, unit cost, supplier, and notes. Support adding, editing, and removing items. Display low-stock alerts for items below the minimum threshold. Allow recording stock usage against a job.
acceptanceCriteria: Inventory list shows all items with current stock levels
Items below minimum threshold are highlighted with a low-stock alert
Stock usage can be recorded and deducted from a job record
Items can be created, edited, and deleted

requirements.text: Create a Technician / Staff Management module. Each technician record includes: name, email, phone, specialization/skills, status (Active/Inactive), assigned jobs count, and notes. Support creating, editing, and deactivating technicians. Show a technician detail page with their assigned job history.
acceptanceCriteria: Technician list shows all staff with active/inactive status badges
Technician detail page shows assigned job history
Technicians can be created, edited, and deactivated
Active technicians appear as options in the job assignment dropdown

requirements.text: Implement a Reports and Analytics module with the following pre-built reports: (1) Jobs Summary — total jobs by status and technician over a selectable date range; (2) Revenue Report — total invoiced and collected amounts by month; (3) Technician Performance — completed jobs and average completion time per technician; (4) Inventory Usage — top parts consumed over a period. Display data in tables with simple bar or line charts.
acceptanceCriteria: All four reports render with data from the backend
Date range filter applies to all reports
Charts (bar/line) display alongside tabular data
Report data reflects actual stored records

requirements.text: Populate the application with realistic mock seed data on first load: at least 10 customers, 5 technicians, 20 jobs in various statuses, 15 invoices, 30 inventory items, and scheduled events spanning the current month. This data should be inserted into the backend on initialization if no records exist.
acceptanceCriteria: On first load, all modules display populated data without manual entry
Seed data is only inserted when no existing records are found
Mock data covers all entities: customers, technicians, jobs, invoices, inventory, schedule

requirements.text: Design a professional field-service management visual theme: a deep navy and steel-gray sidebar navigation with amber/orange accent colors for primary actions and status highlights. Use clean card-based layouts with subtle shadows, a compact data-table style for list views, and a left-sidebar navigation linking to all modules (Dashboard, Jobs, Customers, Invoices, Schedule, Inventory, Technicians, Reports). Apply this theme consistently across all pages.

quotes: I Want software with all of this features

acceptanceCriteria: Left sidebar navigation is present on all pages with links to all 8 modules
Navy/gray sidebar and amber accent colors are applied consistently
Card-based KPI widgets and compact tables are used throughout
Active navigation item is visually highlighted

requirements.text: Generate and render a custom app logo for SKPM Technical Services displayed in the top of the sidebar navigation, using the generated image as a static asset from frontend/public/assets/generated.

quotes: I Want software with all of this features

acceptanceCriteria: Logo image is displayed at the top of the sidebar
Logo loads from the static assets path

constraints: All backend logic must remain in a single Motoko actor (backend/main.mo)
Do not integrate any external APIs, email services, or third-party authentication beyond Internet Identity
Immutable frontend paths (hooks, main.tsx, ui components) must not be modified
nonGoals: PDF invoice generation or email sending
Mobile app or React Native version

required: Professional technical services company logo with stylized wrench-and-gear icon, bold sans-serif text 'SKPM' in white on a deep navy background with amber accent (skpm-logo.dim_200x60.png)
